data.title: Meet the Student Support and Wellbeing team
data.meta_description: Student Support and Wellbeing Services comprises a diverse group of experienced staff dedicated to supporting students throughout their time at UCL.
data.text:
Student Support and Wellbeing Services comprises a diverse group of experienced staff dedicated to supporting students throughout their time at UCL.

Contact us

For general enquiries, please get in touch with us through askUCL, our student enquiries system.

askUCL

Disability, Mental Health and Wellbeing (DMHW) team

Contact the team using askUCL

Responsibilities

Delivers non-therapeutic face-to-face support and advice, enabling students to thrive through drop-ins and appointments.

Oversees implementation of reasonable adjustments, including mental health mentoring and study skills tutoring for students with specific learning difficulties.

Manages return to study and Student of Concern processes.

Student Psychological and Counselling Services (SPCS) team

Email: spcs-info@ucl.ac.uk

Responsibilities

Delivers therapeutic support through counselling (cognitive behavioural therapy and psychodynamic counselling).

Offers psychiatric consultation and group workshops.

Delivers pastoral support and advice around religious or faith concerns.

Study Abroad and International Student Support team

Contact the team using askUCL

Responsibilities

Manages outgoing international student mobility for undergraduates, including through Erasmus.

Manages short-term international student mobility opportunities.

Supports UCL students while studying abroad.

Supports incoming international students to adjust to life in the UK.

Manages the askUCL student enquiries system.

SSW Product team

Responsibilities

Manages the delivery and development of askUCL, RegisterUCL and SPCS systems.

Driven by the vision to capture a holistic student view through a single point of entry.

Continue supporting students across UCL.

Deliver UKVI complaint recording and reporting attendance via RegisterUCL.

Business Partners

Email: ssw-businesspartners@ucl.ac.uk (staff only)

Responsibilities:

Supporting colleagues with complex student cases to ensure students receive holistic and well-coordinated support.

Support and advise about the enactment of student Summary of Reasonable Adjustment (SoRA) documents.

Promoting SSW services and ensuring colleagues have an excellent understanding of how best to signpost or refer students to these services.

Providing information on key SSW developments, initiatives, and changes.

Identifying local training needs in relation to students support and helping to implement appropriate solutions.

Robert Clarke

Development, Campaigns and Projects team

Email: ssw-comms@ucl.ac.uk

Responsibilities

Contributes to the overall Student Support and Wellbeing (SSW) service by promoting services, events and campaigns.

Ensures all UCL students benefit from a rich and diverse range of extracurricular and wellbeing services and experiences which build their sense of community and support positive mental, emotional and physical wellbeing.

Manages SSW’s online information and resources.

Promotes awareness of SSW’s support services and healthy lifestyles.

Manages partnerships with external organisations.

Delivers continuous improvement projects.

Leads enhanced coordination of student inductions across UCL.

Leads support in halls of residence through Wardens and Student Residence Advisers (SRAs).
